Pain assessment interview should be conducted:Find:Pt:^Patient:Ord:MDSv3
Pain Presence. Ask resident: "Have you had pain or hurting any time in the last 5 days?"
Pain Frequency. Ask resident: "How much of the time have you experienced pain or hurting over the last 5 days?"
Ask resident: "Over the past 5 days, has pain made it hard for you to sleep at night?"
Pain has made it hard to sleep in last 5D:Find:Pt:^Patient:Ord:MDSv3
Ask resident: "Over the past 7 days, have you limited your day-to-day activities because of pain?"
Limited activities because of pain in last 5D:Find:Pt:^Patient:Ord:MDSv3

Numeric Rating Scale (00-10). Ask resident: "Please rate your worst pain over the last 5 days on a zero to ten scale, with zero being no pain and ten as the worst pain you can imagine." (Show resident 00-10 pain scale.)
Verbal Descriptor Scale. Ask resident: " Please rate the intensity of your worst pain over the last 5 days." (Show resident verbal scale.)
Rate pain intensity in last 5D using verbal descriptor scale:Find:Pt:^Patient:Ord:MDSv3
e.g., Hepatitis A, B, C, D and E
e.g., diabetic retinopathy, nephropathy, and neuropathy
e.g., hypothyroidism, hyperthyroidism, and Hashimoto's thyroiditis
e.g., degenerative joint disease (DJD), osteoarthritis, and rheumatoid arthritis (RA)
any hip fracture that has a relationship to current status, treatments, monitoring (e.g., sub-capital fractures, fractures of the trochanter and femoral neck)

e.g., Non-Alzheimer's dementia such as vascular or multi-infarct dementia; mixed dementia; frontotemporal dementia such as Pick's disease; and dementia related to stroke, Parkinson's, or Creutzfeldt-Jakob diseases
e.g., chronic bronchitis and restrictive lung diseases such as asbestosis

Stage 1: Intact skin with non-blanchable redness of a localized area usually over a bony prominence. Darkly pigmented skin may not have a visible blanching; in dark skin tones only it may appear with persistent blue or purple hues.
